document.docAuthor: Antić, Dragan, Dražina, Tvrtko, Raða, Tonći, Tomić, Vladimir T. & Makarov, Slobodan E.
document.docTitle: Haasia jalzici Antic and Drazina, sp.n.
document.masterDocTitle: Review of the family Anthogonidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida), with descriptions of three new species from the Balkan Peninsula

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the family Anthogonidae (Diplopoda, Chordeumatida), with descriptions of three new species from the Balkan Peninsula

heading.emphasis:
Haasia jalzici Antić and Dražina
, sp.n.

figureCitation.captionText-0: FIGURES 19 – 22. Haasia jalzici sp. n., paratype male from the Ponor Sušik Cave, Gorski Kotar. 19: body segments XIV and XV, dorsal view; 20: macrochaetal knobs of body segment XV; 21: scale-like structures of metazonite XV; 22: cross-section of body segment XV, posterior view.
figureCitation.captionText-1: FIGURES 23 – 26. Haasia jalzici sp. n., paratype male from the Ponor Sušik Cave, Gorski Kotar, anterior gonopods. 23: anterior view; 24: lateral view; 25: posterior view; 26: postero-distal view. Designations: a: anterior shield-like coxal processes, d: apical posterior denticles, p: postero-mesal protrusion, t: triangulum, ar: arch, b 1: inner bristles apparatus, b 2: posterior bristles apparatus, h 1: outer horn, h 2: inner horn, h 3: lateral horn, lp: lateral parts of syncoxite, sp: basal sternal plate, sco: syncoxite. Scale line: 0.4 mm.
figureCitation.captionText-2: FIGURES 27 – 29. Haasia jalzici sp. n., paratype male from the Ponor Sušik Cave, Gorski Kotar, gonopods. 27: anterior gonopods, anterior view; 28: anterior gonopods, posterior view; 29: posterior gonopods, anterior view. Designations: m: biramous medial sternal process, lcp: lateral coxal process. Scale line: 0.4 mm for Figs 27 and 28, 0.2 mm for Fig. 29.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined. Holotype male: Ponor Sušik Cave, Drežničko Polje, village of Drežnica, near Ogulin, Gorski Kotar, Croatia ,
45 ° 8 '43.00"N
,
15 ° 5 '35.00"E
,
09.VI. 2007
, leg. N. Raguž ( CBSS , DIP 416 ). Paratype male: same data as for holotype (IZB ANG HM 100 – 1 ).

Etymology. The new species is named after Branko Jalžić, renowned Croatian biospeleologist, a man who has led and is still leading numerous speleological, biospeleological, and paleontological explorations of Ponor Sušik Cave.

Diagnosis. Differs from all other
Haasia
species in the presence of a biramous medial sternal process on the posterior gonopods (
Fig. 29
).
Measurements : Holotype male 11.5 mm long, vertical diameter of its largest pleurotergite 1 mm ; paratype male 11 mm long, vertical diameter of its largest pleurotergite 1 mm .

Head ( holotype ♂): With slightly convex frontal side. Labrum with three medial labral teeth, and with 4 + 4 outer, less distinct teeth. With 4 + 4 labral and 2 + 2 supralabral setae. Promentum triangular, without setae; lingual plates with 6 + 6 setae in two rows ( 5 + 5 setae in the outer row and 1 + 1 in the inner row); stipites with 20 + 20 setae. Antennae elongated, 2.4 mm long. Length of antennomeres: I ( 0.12 ), II ( 0.27 ), III ( 0.59 ), IV ( 0.4 ), V ( 0.57 ), VI ( 0.21 ), VII ( 0.22 ), and VIII ( 0.02 ), respectively. Length/breadth ratios of antennomeres I-VII: I ( 1 ), II ( 2 ), III ( 4.5 ), IV ( 3 ), V ( 4 ), VI ( 1.5 ), and VII ( 2.2 ). Antennomeres II, IV, and V slightly clavate. Antennomeres II, IV, V, VI, and VII with one, three, one, four and one sensillum (sensilla), respectively. Blind.
Collum: Narrower than head, with six macrochaetae. Anterior side semicircular, posterior side slightly concave.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 19–22.
Haasia jalzici
sp. n.
, paratype male from the Ponor Sušik Cave, Gorski Kotar. 19: body segments XIV and XV, dorsal view; 20: macrochaetal knobs of body segment XV; 21: scale-like structures of metazonite XV; 22: cross-section of body segment XV, posterior view.

subSubSection.paragraph: Telson: Epiproct with a pair of spinnerets and six setae arranged in two rows ( 2 + 2 marginal trichoid setae and 1 + 1 paramedial bacilliform seta). Hypoproct with two apical trichoid setae. Paraprocts with 3 + 3 marginal trichoid setae.
Walking legs: Elongated. Leg pairs 1 and 2 with tarsal combs, prefemora with several long and robust setae, femora and postfemora with numerous long and robust setae.

Male sexual characters: Leg pairs 3–7 slightly enlarged. Leg pair 7 with saber-like tarsi. Without other peculiarities on leg pairs 3–7 . Leg pairs 10 and 11 with coxal glands, without other peculiarities.

Posterior gonopods (
Fig. 29
): Medial sternal process ( m ) [= medianen Aufsatz sensu
Verhoeff ( 1930 )
, Mittelfortsatz/Mittelaufsatz sensu Strasser (1935 , 1940 ,
1966 a
,
1966 b
), or medial sternite process sensu
Mršić ( 1992 )
] is divided into two long, orally curved horns. In situ these horns touch the medial area of the syncoxite (top of the triangulum). Lateral coxal processes ( lcp ) [= gonopodialen Fortsätze sensu
Verhoeff ( 1930 )
and Strasser (1935 , 1966b ), Seitenteile sensu Strasser (1940 , 1966b ), or lateral sternite processes sensu
Mršić ( 1992 )
] are well developed, wide, and shield-like in lateral view. Both anterior and posterior sides strongly denticulated. Posterior side with the greater number of denticles. Anterior side with a few denticles, of which the basal one is the largest.
